title: General Election 2019 poll tracker: Lead for Boris Johnson as campaign begins
text:
Boris Johnson is poised to call a general election for 12 December after Parliament backed it, meaning that the country now faces its fourth national vote in five years.

Two-party politics made a triumphant return at the 2017 general election with more than 80 per cent of voters casting a ballot for one of the two main parties.

However, this year the polls have been extremely volatile, with three different parties having taken the lead at some point and the Liberal Democrats performing strongly in fourth.

The Conservatives currently hold the lead, but with six weeks to go until election day there is still ample time for public opinion to shift - just as it did away from Theresa May in 2017. ...
description: Boris Johnson is poised to call a general election for 12 December after Parliament backed it, meaning that the country now faces its fourth national vote in five years.
